channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Minnesotans turn out in the frigid cold to protest Trump's immigration crackdown
item.description: Minnesota residents took to the streets of downtown Minneapolis to protest the federal government's immigration campaign in the state, after weeks of sustained resistance in their communities. Businesses across the region closed in solidarity.
item.content:encoded:
Minnesota residents took to the streets of downtown Minneapolis to protest the federal government's immigration campaign in the state, after weeks of sustained resistance in their communities. Businesses across the region closed in solidarity.

(Image credit: Erin Trieb for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Meg Anderson

item.title: Trump expands policy banning aid to groups abroad that discuss or provide abortions
item.description: In addition to adding to the list of groups that will lose funding for providing or discussing abortion, the policy now also calls for ending aid to groups that embrace DEI.
item.content:encoded:
In addition to adding to the list of groups that will lose funding for providing or discussing abortion, the policy now also calls for ending aid to groups that embrace DEI.

(Image credit: Samantha Reinders for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Lambert

item.title: At Davos, U.S. allies question a fraying world order
item.description: It was a volatile week for trans-Atlantic relations, marked by President Trump statements that unsettled global markets and strained ties with U.S. allies — on topics ranging from Greenland to Gaza.
item.content:encoded:
It was a volatile week for trans-Atlantic relations, marked by President Trump statements that unsettled global markets and strained ties with U.S. allies — on topics ranging from Greenland to Gaza.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: 'Get warm, get safe and stay there,' officials warn as massive storm bears down on U.S.
item.description: Forecasters say the storm will dump heavy snow, sleet and freezing rain from the Southern Rockies into New England through Monday.
item.content:encoded: Forecasters say the storm will dump heavy snow, sleet and freezing rain from the Southern Rockies into New England through Monday.
item.dc:creator: Debbie Elliott

item.title: Gladys West, mathematician whose work paved the way for GPS, dies at 95
item.description: A self-described "little farm girl" in the Jim Crow Era, Gladys West's complex and pioneering work for the U.S. Navy helped to improve billions of lives — and keep us from getting lost.
item.content:encoded: A self-described "little farm girl" in the Jim Crow Era, Gladys West's complex and pioneering work for the U.S. Navy helped to improve billions of lives — and keep us from getting lost.
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: A Canadian Olympic snowboarder turned alleged drug kingpin is arrested in Mexico
item.description: Ryan Wedding was among the FBI's top fugitives and faces charges related to drug trafficking and the killing of a federal witness. He reportedly turned himself in at the U.S. embassy in Mexico
item.content:encoded:
Ryan Wedding was among the FBI's top fugitives and faces charges related to drug trafficking and the killing of a federal witness. He reportedly turned himself in at the U.S. embassy in Mexico

(Image credit: Damian Dovarganes)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Weather influencers are going viral. How much should we trust them?
item.description: The weather genre online spans a wide range of sources. Experts say that while weather influencers can help fill an information gap, social media platforms tend to prioritize likes over accuracy.
item.content:encoded:
The weather genre online spans a wide range of sources. Experts say that while weather influencers can help fill an information gap, social media platforms tend to prioritize likes over accuracy.

(Image credit: Kena Betancur)
item.dc:creator: Ava Berger

item.title: Vietnam leader To Lam consolidates power as country targets 10% growth
item.description: Lam, 68, pledged to accelerate economic growth and was reappointed unanimously by the 180-member Central Committee at the conclusion of the National Party Congress.
item.content:encoded:
Lam, 68, pledged to accelerate economic growth and was reappointed unanimously by the 180-member Central Committee at the conclusion of the National Party Congress.

(Image credit: Hoang Thong Nhat/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Millions of Americans brace for winter storm. And, Zelenskyy's warning for Europe
item.description: Millions of Americans are bracing for a massive, life-threatening winter storm this weekend. And, Ukrainian President Zelenskyy delivers a stark message to Europe at the World Economic Forum in Davos.
item.content:encoded:
Millions of Americans are bracing for a massive, life-threatening winter storm this weekend. And, Ukrainian President Zelenskyy delivers a stark message to Europe at the World Economic Forum in Davos.

(Image credit: Will Newton)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: How cuts to federal climate funds could threaten polar vortex research
item.description: Tens of millions of people are in the path of a major winter storm. Federal cuts threaten efforts to understand the causes of such weather.
item.content:encoded:
Tens of millions of people are in the path of a major winter storm. Federal cuts threaten efforts to understand the causes of such weather.

(Image credit: George Walker IV)
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Hersher
